    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        public org.gbif.api.model.common.DoiData resolve(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi)
                                          throws DoiException
        Detecting the status might need 2 calls. A reserved DOI returns metadata and either the test or NULL target URL. An active registered DOI returns metadata and a target URI A deleted but registered DOI returns a http 410 for the metadata and still the target URI.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to resolve
        Returns:
        the status object with the target URL the DOI is backed by or null if DOI does not exist at all
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • reserve

        public void reserve(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
           String metadata)
             throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Reserves a new identifier and defines its initial metadata. Reserved ids are not known to resolvers yet and can still be fully deleted.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to reserve
        metadata - the metadata to be associated with the doi given as a valid DataCite v3.1 XML document. The identifier inside the metadata will be overwritten by the doi parameter given
        Throws:
        DoiExistsException - if the DOI existed already regardless of its status
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • reserve

        public void reserve(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
           DataCiteMetadata metadata)
             throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Reserves a new identifier and defines its initial metadata. Reserved ids are not known to resolvers yet and can still be fully deleted.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to reserve
        metadata - the metadata to be associated with the doi. The identifier inside the metadata will be overwritten by the doi parameter given
        Throws:
        DoiExistsException - if the DOI existed already regardless of its status
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • register

        public void register(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
            URI target,
            String metadata)
              throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Registers an identifier that is either brand new, has been reserved or is currently marked as deleted. It assigns the latest metadata and a URL for resolution. This causes the DOI to be publicly registered with resolvers and other external services.
        DataCite and EZID restrict target URL domains and the target URL given MUST have a domain matching your account permissions.
        You can also call this method to re-register previously deleted, registered DOIs that are currently marked as inactive (DataCite) or unavailable (EZID). Because the API of these 2 implementations differ in how to re-register deleted DOIs (DataCite requires new metadata, EZID needs a new terget URL), we have to take both the metadata and the target URL as params.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to register
        target - the URL the DOI should resolve to
        metadata - the metadata to be associated with the doi given as a valid DataCite v3.1 XML document. The identifier inside the metadata will be overwritten by the explicitly given DOI
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason
        DoiExistsException - if the DOI was already registered

      • register

        public void register(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
            URI target,
            DataCiteMetadata metadata)
              throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Registers an identifier that is either brand new, has been reserved or is currently marked as deleted. It assigns the latest metadata and a URL for resolution. This causes the DOI to be publicly registered with resolvers and other external services.
        DataCite and EZID restrict target URL domains and the target URL given MUST have a domain matching your account permissions.
        You can also call this method to re-register previously deleted, registered DOIs that are currently marked as inactive (DataCite) or unavailable (EZID). Because the API of these 2 implementations differ in how to re-register deleted DOIs (DataCite requires new metadata, EZID needs a new terget URL), we have to take both the metadata and the target URL as params.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to register
        target - the URL the DOI should resolve to
        metadata - the metadata to be associated with the doi. The identifier inside the metadata will be overwritten by the explicitly given DOI
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason
        DoiExistsException - if the DOI was already registered

      • delete

        public boolean delete(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi)
               throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Tries to delete an identifier. If the DOI has only been reserved it will be fully deleted, if it was registered before it cannot be deleted as DOIs are permanent identifiers. In DataCite a DOI will be marked as "inactive" though, in EZID as "unavailable". You can re-register a deleted DOI again if needed.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to delete
        Returns:
        true if the reserved DOI was fully deleted, false if it was only marked as deleted
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • update

        public void update(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
          String metadata)
            throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Updates the identifier metadata. This method must be called every time the object or metadata referenced by the identifier changes (e.g. a dataset gets republished, a dataset is replaced by a new major version, etc).
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier of metadata to update
        metadata - the datacite metadata given as a valid DataCite v3.1 XML document
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • update

        public void update(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
          DataCiteMetadata metadata)
            throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Updates the identifier metadata. This method must be called every time the object or metadata referenced by the identifier changes (e.g. a dataset gets republished, a dataset is replaced by a new major version, etc).
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier of metadata to update
        metadata - the datacite metadata
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • update

        public void update(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
          URI target)
            throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Updates the registered identifier's target URL. DataCite and EZID restrict target URL domains and the target URL given MUST have a domain matching your account permissions.
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier of metadata to update
        target - the new URL the DOI should resolve to
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason
